circumstances: While approaching LaGuardia Airport in poor weather conditions (low ceiling and fog), both engines failed. The pilot lost control of the airplane that crashed at Pelham Bay Park, Bronx, about five miles north of the airport. A passenger was seriously injured while seven other occupants were killed.
probable_cause:
Double engine failure on approach due to fuel exhaustion. The following contributing factors were reported:
- Inadequate preflight preparation, 
- Mismanagement of fuel,
- Fuel exhaustion, 
- Low ceiling,
- Fog,
- Fuel quantity gauge - erratic.
